name: zpa
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing zpa cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`zpa` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/zscaler/terraform-provider-zpa).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing zpa cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/zscaler/terraform-provider-zpa)
> distributed under [MIT](https://mit-license.org/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-zpa` repo](https://github.com/zscaler/pulumi-zpa/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-zpa` repo](https://github.com/zscaler/terraform-provider-zpa/issues).

lhs.description: (string) Signifies the key for the object type Supported values: `SIZE`, `VALUE`

op.description: (string) If lhs is set to SIZE, then the user may pass one of the following: `EQ: Equals`, `LE: Less than or equal to`, `GE: Greater than or equal to`. If the lhs is set to `VALUE`, then the user may pass one of the following: `CONTAINS`, `STARTS_WITH`, `ENDS_WITH`, `RX`.

rhs.description: (string) Denotes the value for the given object type. Its value depends on the key. If rules.type is set to REQUEST_METHOD, the conditions.rhs field must have one of the following values: `GET`,`HEAD`, `POST`, `OPTIONS`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `TRACE`

provider.description:
The provider type for the zpa package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

Cloud to use PRODUCTION, BETA, GOV or PREVIEW

zpa:AccessPolicy/policyAccessRule:Policy.description:
## Import

Zscaler offers a dedicated tool called Zscaler-Terraformer to allow the automated import of ZPA configurations into Terraform-compliant HashiCorp Configuration Language. [Visit](https://github.com/zscaler/zscaler-terraformer) Policy access rule can be imported by using `<POLICY ACCESS RULE ID>` as the import ID. For example

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:AccessPolicy/policyAccessRule:PolicyAccessRule example <policy_access_rule_id>
```

action.description: (Optional) This is for providing the rule action. Supported values: ``ALLOW``, ``DENY``

actionId.description: This field defines the description of the server.

appServerGroups.description: List of the server group IDs.

customMsg.description: (Optional) This is for providing a customer message for the user.

defaultRule.description: This is for providing a customer message for the user.

description.description: (Optional) This is the description of the access policy rule.

name.description: (Optional)

action.description: (Optional) This is for providing the rule action. Supported values: ``ALLOW``, ``DENY``

actionId.description: This field defines the description of the server.

appServerGroups.description: List of the server group IDs.

defaultRule.description: This is for providing a customer message for the user.

description.description: (Optional) This is the description of the access policy rule.

name.description: (Optional)

name.description: (Optional)

cityCountry.description: Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app. i.e ``"San Jose, US"``

description.description: Description of the App Connector Group.

enabled.description: Whether this App Connector Group is enabled or not. Default value: `true`. Supported values: `true`, `false`

latitude.description: Latitude of the App Connector Group. Integer or decimal. With values in the range of `-90` to `90`

location.description: Location of the App Connector Group. i.e ``"San Jose, CA, USA"``

longitude.description: Longitude of the App Connector Group. Integer or decimal. With values in the range of `-180` to `180`

name.description: Name of the App Connector Group.

overrideVersionProfile.description: Whether the default version profile of the App Connector Group is applied or overridden. Default: `false` Supported values: `true`, `false`

tcpQuickAckApp.description: Whether TCP Quick Acknowledgement is enabled or disabled for the application. The tcpQuickAckApp, tcpQuickAckAssistant, and tcpQuickAckReadAssistant fields must all share the same value. Supported values: `true`, `false`

tcpQuickAckAssistant.description: Whether TCP Quick Acknowledgement is enabled or disabled for the application. The tcpQuickAckApp, tcpQuickAckAssistant, and tcpQuickAckReadAssistant fields must all share the same value. Supported values: `true`, `false`

tcpQuickAckReadAssistant.description: Whether TCP Quick Acknowledgement is enabled or disabled for the application. The tcpQuickAckApp, tcpQuickAckAssistant, and tcpQuickAckReadAssistant fields must all share the same value. Supported values: `true`, `false`

upgradeDay.description: App Connectors in this group will attempt to update to a newer version of the software during this specified day i.e ``SUNDAY``

upgradeTimeInSecs.description: App Connectors in this group will attempt to update to a newer version of the software during this specified time. Default value: `66600`. Integer in seconds (i.e., `-66600`). The integer should be greater than or equal to `0` and less than `86400`, in `15` minute intervals

versionProfileId.description: ID of the version profile. To learn more, see Version Profile Use Cases. Supported values are:

versionProfileName.description:
Name of the version profile. To learn more, see Version Profile Use Cases. This value is required, if the value for
overrideVersionProfile is set to true

zpa:ApplicationSegment/applicationSegmen.description:
## Import

Zscaler offers a dedicated tool called Zscaler-Terraformer to allow the automated import of ZPA configurations into Terraform-compliant HashiCorp Configuration Language. [Visit](https://github.com/zscaler/zscaler-terraformer) Application Segment can be imported by using `<APPLICATION SEGMENT ID>` or `<APPLICATION SEGMENT NAME>` as the import ID.

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ApplicationSegment/applicationSegment:ApplicationSegment example <application_segment_id>
```

 or

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ApplicationSegment/applicationSegment:ApplicationSegment example <application_segment_name>
```

bypassType.description: (Optional) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications.

doubleEncrypt.description: (Optional) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app.

enabled.description: (Optional) Whether this application is enabled or not.

healthReporting.description: (Optional) Whether health reporting for the app is Continuous or On Access. Supported values: `NONE`, `ON_ACCESS`, `CONTINUOUS`.

isCnameEnabled.description: (Optional) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors.

name.description: Name. The name of the App Connector Group to be exported.

tcpPortRanges.description: TCP port ranges used to access the app.

udpPortRanges.description: UDP port ranges used to access the app.

bypassType.description: (Optional) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications.

doubleEncrypt.description: (Optional) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app.

enabled.description: (Optional) Whether this application is enabled or not.

healthReporting.description: (Optional) Whether health reporting for the app is Continuous or On Access. Supported values: `NONE`, `ON_ACCESS`, `CONTINUOUS`.

isCnameEnabled.description: (Optional) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors.

name.description: Name. The name of the App Connector Group to be exported.

tcpPortRanges.description: TCP port ranges used to access the app.

udpPortRanges.description: UDP port ranges used to access the app.

isCnameEnabled.description: (Optional) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors.

name.description: Name. The name of the App Connector Group to be exported.

tcpPortRanges.description: TCP port ranges used to access the app.

udpPortRanges.description: UDP port ranges used to access the app.

bypassType.description: (Optional) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications. Default value is: `NEVER` and supported values are: `ALWAYS`, `NEVER` and `ON_NET`. The value `NEVER` indicates the use of the client forwarding policy.

doubleEncrypt.description: (Optional) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app.

enabled.description: (Optional) - Whether this app is enabled or not.

healthReporting.description: (Optional) Whether health reporting for the app is Continuous or On Access. Supported values: `NONE`, `ON_ACCESS`, `CONTINUOUS`.

ipAnchored.description: (Optional) - If Source IP Anchoring for use with ZIA, is enabled or disabled for the app. Supported values are `true` and `false`

isCnameEnabled.description: (Optional) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors.

name.description: Name of the application.

tcpPortRanges.description: TCP port ranges used to access the app.

udpPortRanges.description: UDP port ranges used to access the app.

bypassType.description: (Optional) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications. Default value is: `NEVER` and supported values are: `ALWAYS`, `NEVER` and `ON_NET`. The value `NEVER` indicates the use of the client forwarding policy.

doubleEncrypt.description: (Optional) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app.

enabled.description: (Optional) - Whether this app is enabled or not.

healthReporting.description: (Optional) Whether health reporting for the app is Continuous or On Access. Supported values: `NONE`, `ON_ACCESS`, `CONTINUOUS`.

ipAnchored.description: (Optional) - If Source IP Anchoring for use with ZIA, is enabled or disabled for the app. Supported values are `true` and `false`

udpPortRanges.description: UDP port ranges used to access the app.

bypassType.description: (Optional) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications. Default value is: `NEVER` and supported values are: `ALWAYS`, `NEVER` and `ON_NET`. The value `NEVER` indicates the use of the client forwarding policy.

doubleEncrypt.description: (Optional) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app.

enabled.description: (Optional) - Whether this app is enabled or not.

healthReporting.description: (Optional) Whether health reporting for the app is Continuous or On Access. Supported values: `NONE`, `ON_ACCESS`, `CONTINUOUS`.

ipAnchored.description: (Optional) - If Source IP Anchoring for use with ZIA, is enabled or disabled for the app. Supported values are `true` and `false`

isCnameEnabled.description: (Optional) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors.

zpa:ApplicationServer/applicationServer:.description:
## Import

Zscaler offers a dedicated tool called Zscaler-Terraformer to allow the automated import of ZPA configurations into Terraform-compliant HashiCorp Configuration Language. [Visit](https://github.com/zscaler/zscaler-terraformer) Application Server can be imported by using `<APPLICATION SERVER ID>` or `<APPLICATION SERVER NAME>` as the import ID For example

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ApplicationServer/applicationServer:ApplicationServer example <application_server_id>
```

 or

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ApplicationServer/applicationServer:ApplicationServer example <application_server_name>
```

address.description: Address. The address of the application server to be exported.

appServerGroupIds.description: (Optional) This field defines the list of server group IDs.

description.description: (Optional) This field defines the description of the server.

enabled.description: (Optional) This field defines the status of the server.

name.description: Name. The name of the application server to be exported.

address.description: Address. The address of the application server to be exported.

zpa:ProvisioningKey/provisioningKey:Prov.description:
## Import

Zscaler offers a dedicated tool called Zscaler-Terraformer to allow the automated import of ZPA configurations into Terraform-compliant HashiCorp Configuration Language. [Visit](https://github.com/zscaler/zscaler-terraformer) Provisioning key can be imported by using `<PROVISIONING KEY ID>` or `<PROVISIONING KEY NAME>` as the import ID. For example

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ProvisioningKey/provisioningKey:ProvisioningKey example <provisioning_key_id>
```

 or

```sh
 $ pulumi import zpa:ProvisioningKey/provisioningKey:ProvisioningKey example <provisioning_key_name>
```

appConnectorGroupName.description: Read only property. Applicable only for GET calls, ignored in PUT/POST calls.

associationType.description: Specifies the provisioning key type for App Connectors or ZPA Private Service Edges. The supported values are `CONNECTOR_GRP` and `SERVICE_EDGE_GRP`

enabled.description: Whether the provisioning key is enabled or not. Supported values: true, false

enrollmentCertId.description: ID of the enrollment certificate that can be used for this provisioning key. `ID` of the existing enrollment certificate that has the private key

enrollmentCertName.description: Read only property. Applicable only for GET calls, ignored in PUT/POST calls.

key.description: read only field. Ignored in PUT/POST calls.

maxUsage.description: The maximum number of instances where this provisioning key can be used for enrolling an App Connector or Service Edge.

name.description: Name of the provisioning key.

zcomponentId.description: ID of the existing App Connector or Service Edge Group.

zcomponentName.description: Read only property. Applicable only for GET calls, ignored in PUT/POST calls.

associationType.description: Specifies the provisioning key type for App Connectors or ZPA Private Service Edges. The supported values are `CONNECTOR_GRP` and `SERVICE_EDGE_GRP`

name.description: Name of the provisioning key.

description.description: Description of the Service Edge Group.

enabled.description: Whether this Service Edge Group is enabled or not. Default value: `true` Supported values: `true`, `false`

isPublic.description: Enable or disable public access for the Service Edge Group. Default value: `false` Supported values: `true`, `false`

latitude.description: Latitude for the Service Edge Group. Integer or decimal with values in the range of `-90` to `90`

location.description: Location for the Service Edge Group.

longitude.description: Longitude for the Service Edge Group. Integer or decimal with values in the range of `-180` to `180`

name.description: Name of the Service Edge Group.

overrideVersionProfile.description: Whether the default version profile of the App Connector Group is applied or overridden. Default: `false` Supported values: `true`, `false`

trustedNetworks.description: Trusted networks for this Service Edge Group. List of trusted network objects

upgradeDay.description: Service Edges in this group will attempt to update to a newer version of the software during this specified day. Default value: `SUNDAY` List of valid days (i.e., Sunday, Monday)

upgradeTimeInSecs.description: Service Edges in this group will attempt to update to a newer version of the software during this specified time. Default value: `66600` Integer in seconds (i..e, 66600). The integer must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than `86400`, in `15` minute intervals

bypassType.description: (string) Indicates whether users can bypass ZPA to access applications. Default: `NEVER`. Supported values: `ALWAYS`, `NEVER`, `ON_NET`. The value `NEVER` indicates the use of the client forwarding policy.

doubleEncrypt.description: (string) Whether Double Encryption is enabled or disabled for the app. Default: false. Boolean: `true`, `false`.

enabled.description: (bool)

isCnameEnabled.description: (bool) Indicates if the Zscaler Client Connector (formerly Zscaler App or Z App) receives CNAME DNS records from the connectors. Default: true. Boolean: `true`, `false`.

name.description: (string)

Integer in seconds (i.e., `-66600`). The integer should be greater than or equal to `0` and less than `86400`, in `15` minute intervals
